definition: rarely known to anyone (idiom); almost unknown/secret to all but a few
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
Mao: The Unknown Story by Jung Chang 張戎|张戎 and Jon Halliday
pinyin: Mao2 Ze2 dong1 · Xian1 wei2 ren2 zhi1 de5 Gu4 shi5
containing_words.word: 毛泽东·鲜为人知的故事

sentences.english: Most citizens of that little-known tribe are manikins .
sentences.chinese: 那个鲜为人知的部落的大部分居民都是小矮人。

sentences.english: A rare behind-the-scenes glimpse at the nation's most elite military unit.
sentences.chinese: 一组美国最精锐部队鲜为人知的镜头。

sentences.english: However, little is known about how the company checks each app.
sentences.chinese: 然而，关于公司如何检查每个应用程序却鲜为人知。

sentences.english: The little-known Elwha River in Washington State is set to be free flowing within 3 years.
sentences.chinese: 华盛顿州鲜为人知的尔瓦河将在三年之后通畅无阻。

sentences.english: Here the author tries to introduce you Lang's out- standing portrait-painting from rarely known aspect.
sentences.chinese: 本文从鲜为人知的角度，介绍了他出色的人物肖像画。

sentences.english: The manufacturing industry of the financial machine tool is a new profession in china.
sentences.chinese: 金融机具制造业在我国属鲜为人知的新兴行业。

sentences.english: Biographers excel at dredging up little known facts.
sentences.chinese: 传记作者们善于发掘鲜为人知的事实。

sentences.english: A lesser-known Earth weapon, this, but one that is no less perilous for visitors.
sentences.chinese: 这一地球武器鲜为人知，但对入侵着的危害可不小。

sentences.english: There was in fact a recognized tariff for the scout on such occasion.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是有关园艺的鲜为人知的事实和谬传。

sentences.english: This is a little-known story of the Qimei.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个鲜为人知的凄美的故事。

sentences.english: Chen Xueshao is an obscure woman write who found herself during the New Cultural Movement.
sentences.chinese: 陈学昭是新文学运动中成长起来却鲜为人知的女作家。

definition: to be famous far and wide (idiom)
to announce to the world (idiom)/to make public/to let everyone know
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
